title: Chaco Culture National Historical Park: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park       Looking to learn more? Explore below:  History & Culture   All roads lead to Chaco. By 1050, Chaco had become the ceremonial, administrative, and economic center of the San Juan Basin. Its sphere of influence was extensive. Dozens of great houses in Chaco Canyon were connected by roads to more than 150 great houses throughout the region.   Photos & More   Experience Chaco from afar! Check out photos of the great houses and of Chaco's dark night sky.   Nature   Chaco is more than just spectacular architecture. The canyon's geology, wildlife and vegetation make this a special landscape.   Teachers   Have a ranger come to your classroom and/or bring your students out to Chaco. Your outdoor classroom awaits!
